title: 103_hr793
content: The Act may be cited as the "Bramwell National Historical Park Act of 1993". It includes findings and purpose. The Act, known as the "Bramwell National Historical Park Act of 1993", highlights the national significance of the coal mining heritage in southern West Virginia, specifically in the Town of Bramwell. The purpose of the Act is to preserve, restore, and interpret the historical, cultural, and architectural values of Bramwell for the benefit of current and future generations. Establishment of Bramwell National Historical Park to preserve historical, cultural, and architectural values in Bramwell, West Virginia. Park includes lands within the Town of Bramwell. The Secretary administers the Park in accordance with the Act and applicable laws, including accepting donations and entering into cooperative agreements. The Secretary may acquire land for the Park's purposes. SEC. 5. The Secretary can acquire land within the Park through donation, exchange, or purchase with funds. State-owned lands can only be acquired through donation. SEC. 6. The Secretary can make cooperative agreements with owners of historically or culturally significant properties for preservation efforts. SEC. 7. Property owner rights are protected. Property owner rights are protected, and the Secretary cannot access private residential property within the Park without the owner's consent. A management plan is also required. The Secretary, in consultation with a committee, will prepare a plan for the restoration, preservation, interpretation, and development of historical, cultural, and architectural resources in the Park. The plan includes measures for restoring public areas like streets and mitigating the visual impact of utility facilities. The plan for the development of public areas within the Park includes measures such as reconstructing the Bramwell Railroad Depot and restoring edifices for visitor appreciation of historical, cultural, and architectural features. SEC. 9. ADVISORY COMMITTEE. The Bramwell National Historical Park Advisory Committee is established with thirteen members appointed by the Secretary, including the Governor of West Virginia and the Mayor of Bramwell. Members serve two-year terms and can be reappointed for multiple terms. The Secretary or designee serves as Chairman. The Committee advises on park management and development issues, meeting regularly with the Secretary. The Advisory Committee for Bramwell National Historical Park consists of members appointed by the Secretary, including representatives from the Governor of West Virginia, West Virginia Division of Culture and History, Mayor of Bramwell, Mercer County Commission, Mercer County Historical Society, and Bramwell Historic Landmark Commission. Members serve without compensation but may be reimbursed for expenses incurred. The Advisory Committee for Bramwell National Historical Park includes members representing various organizations such as the Bramwell Historic Landmark Commission, Bramwell Millionaire Garden Club, West Virginia Preservation Alliance, Coalways Inc., West Virginia Association of Museums, and Pinnacle Rock State Park Foundation. The Committee will terminate ten years after the enactment of the Act, with waivers to certain provisions of the Federal Advisory Committee Act. SEC. 10. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS: Sums may be appropriated as necessary for the Act's purpose.
